entry.title: All OS X builds delayed
entry.content:
Jun 30, 21:19 UTC
Resolved - Mac builds are being processed normally.

Jun 30, 16:10 UTC
Update - After canceling older jobs, .org Mac build queue still has a sizable back log, resulting in noticeable delay.

Jun 30, 14:45 UTC
Update - We are starting to cancel older outstanding Mac builds on .org

Jun 30, 13:32 UTC
Update - Private builds on the Mac are being processed normally.

Jun 30, 12:29 UTC
Update - We still have a substantial back log on the public Mac build queue before the busiest time of the day. We will cancel queued jobs starting around 10:00 EDT (14:00 UTC, 16:00 CEST, 07:00 PDT).

Jun 29, 21:45 UTC
Monitoring - Backlog is being processed on both sites. We'll continue to make updates as things progress.

Jun 29, 20:39 UTC
Update - We are continuiing to process the backlog on both sites, so delays will continue. We'll post updates as we begin to catch up on the backlog

Jun 29, 18:46 UTC
Update - We're beginning to process builds for both travis-ci.org and travis-ci.com and we are monitoring things closely. We'll provide another update in 60 minutes or if we have an update sooner.

Jun 29, 18:23 UTC
Update - We've been able to stabilize and repair the core virtualization layer and after some testing in staging, we're beginning to ramp up capacity to start processing jobs, but with partial capacity at first. We'll provide another update in 60 minutes or if we have an update sooner.

Jun 29, 18:00 UTC
Update - We're working in our infrastructure provider and vendor support on getting our core virtualization layer back into service and we hope to have start processing builds again within the next 60-90 minutes. We'll provide another update in 60 minutes or if we have an update sooner.

Jun 29, 17:04 UTC
Update - We're working in our infrastructure provider and vendor support on rissues with our core virtualization layer. We'll provide another update in 60 minutes or if we have an update sooner.

Jun 29, 16:20 UTC
Update - At this time there's no change in the state of things. All of our OSX builds are currently paused due to issues with our core virtualization layer and we're working in our infrastructure provider and vendor support on recovering things. We'll provide another update in 60 minutes or if we have an update sooner.

Jun 29, 15:14 UTC
Update - We apologize for the continued delays. All of our OSX builds are currently paused due to issues with our core virtualization layer and we're working in our infrastructure provider and vendor support on recovering things. We'll provide another update in 60 minutes or if we have an update sooner.

Jun 29, 14:04 UTC
Update - We're going to temporarily pause all OS X related build processing

Jun 29, 13:55 UTC
Update - In order to work to stabilize some internal load in our vSphere cluster and get back to full capacity, we're going to be throttling builds for a few minutes and this will increase build delays temporarily.

Jun 29, 13:00 UTC
Identified - We're currently running with reduced capacity for our OSX builders, due to some hosts having hardware issues. We're working with our infrastructure provider to determine why and resolve the issue

entry.title: Network maintenance on Mac infrastructure
entry.content:
Jun 30, 10:47 UTC
Completed - The network maintenance is completed.

Jun 30, 10:00 UTC
In progress - Our Mac infrastructure provider is performing network maintenance in order to increase the capacity and efficiency of the network. We're expecting several momentary network interruptions during the maintenance, which might cause delays in builds starting, or possibly false errors in builds at points where the build depends on external network access.

Jun 28, 02:08 UTC
Scheduled - Our Mac infrastructure provider will be performing maintenance on June 30th from 10:00 UTC to 10:45 UTC. We're expecting some build requeues during this window as the upstream network connection will be unavailable for short periods of time.

entry.title: Maintenance on Mac infrastructure causing delayed builds
entry.content:
Jun 27, 12:07 UTC
Resolved - The backlog has cleared and Mac OS X builds are running as expected. Thank you!

Jun 27, 10:54 UTC
Monitoring - The maintenance has been completed. Builds are processing normally. We are closely monitoring the situation as we work through the backlog.

Jun 27, 10:43 UTC
Identified - Our Mac infrastructure provider is performing maintenance, which is causing some delayed Mac builds.

entry.title: Increased boot times on Mac infrastructure
entry.content:
Jun 23, 04:04 UTC
Resolved - We managed to process all the remaining queued builds for public repositories on our Mac infrastructure. Thank you for your enduring patience.

Jun 22, 07:21 UTC
Update - Just about all of the closed source jobs which were in the job backlog have processed. Open source jobs are still backed up, but processing normally.

Jun 22, 05:55 UTC
Monitoring - We've restarted all of our workers and the queue is draining as it is expected to do so. We're monitoring things closely as jobs process.

Jun 22, 05:29 UTC
Update - All the stale VMs have cleared! We'll be restarting workers momentarily.

Jun 22, 04:43 UTC
Update - We've coordinated with our infrastructure provider to restart our vCenter instance, which had become unresponsive, and it has come back up. We're actively working to continue cleaning up the stale VMs.

Jun 22, 03:22 UTC
Update - We're still working on cleaning up the stale VMs. At this time we have stopped all Mac workers in order to help the cleanup go faster.

Jun 22, 00:45 UTC
Identified - We're working on cleaning up some stale VMs on our Mac infrastructure, you may experience increased boot times for the time being.

entry.title: Issues with some restarts of travis-ci.com builds
entry.content:
Jun 16, 23:20 UTC
Resolved - At this time things are operating as expected.

Jun 16, 21:57 UTC
Identified - We've identified a service which helps handle the restarts, that was not running correctly and we've implemented a fix. We're starting to process delayed requests and are increasing some capacity to handle the backlog.

Jun 16, 20:15 UTC
Investigating - We are investigating reports of sssues with some restarts of travis-ci.com builds

entry.title: Build delays for sudo: required builds on both travis-ci.org and travis-ci.com
entry.content:
Jun 7, 17:22 UTC
Resolved - This has been resolved and all affected builds should have started now. Please drop us a line at support@travis-ci.com for any further questions. Thanks for your patience!

Jun 7, 17:03 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Jun 7, 16:58 UTC
Update - We've deployed a fix for this issue and we are currently working through the backlog.

Jun 7, 16:20 UTC
Identified - We've identified the source of the delays as part of very recent improvements to restart jobs. We're working on a fix now.

Jun 7, 15:23 UTC
Investigating - We are investigating build delays on the GCE infrastructure.

entry.title: Increased response times for web endpoints
entry.content:
Jun 2, 12:29 UTC
Resolved - The upstream issue is reported to be resolved, and response times are back to normal.

Jun 2, 12:13 UTC
Identified - One of our upstream providers is investigating network instability causing slow response times on our website and API.

Jun 2, 12:04 UTC
Investigating - We're investigating reports of increased response times on our web endpoints (the API and the travis-ci.org/travis-ci.com website).

entry.title: GCE platform job requeues causing build delays
entry.content:
Jun 1, 17:01 UTC
Resolved - The backlog has cleared. Jobs are now processing normally. Sorry for the interruption! 🙂

Jun 1, 16:28 UTC
Monitoring - The requeue event has been resolved. We are working through the backlog and will provide an update once it has been cleared.

Jun 1, 15:37 UTC
Identified - Due to leaking resources some users may experience their jobs being requeued on the GCE platform.

entry.title: Database Maintenance for travis-ci.com and travis-ci.org on Sun, May 29th 12:00 - 16:00 UTC
entry.content:
May 29, 13:07 UTC
Completed - Database maintenance was successful, everything should be up and running again.

May 29, 12:36 UTC
Update - Maintenance ran successfully on travis-ci.org, which is back up and running. Putting travis-ci.com into maintenance mode.

May 29, 12:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

May 26, 18:02 UTC
Scheduled - We will be performing database maintenance that's required by our Infrastructure Provider. This Database Maintenance is for both travis-ci.com and travis-ci.org and is schedule for Sunday, May 29th 12:00 - 16:00 UTC

During this time, we'll be stopping certain parts of the Travis CI backends, which will result in jobs being paused. Our API and web interface will also be temporarily unavailable. You'll see a maintenance page on the web interface.

We *will not* lose any existing queued jobs, nor will we lose any incoming web hook events. They will both be queued until we return those parts of this system to full functionality.

We do not expect the time things are paused to take more than 30 minutes for each site, but are scheduling sufficient time to handle any unanticipated things which may come up.

Please email support@travis-ci.com if you have any questions or concerns.

entry.title: Github issues resulting in surge of builds and build delays
entry.content:
May 23, 21:00 UTC
Resolved - At this time all systems are operating as expected. If you see any issues, please email support@travis-ci.com

May 23, 18:38 UTC
Monitoring - We've cleared most of the additional load generated by this event and our monitoring things closely.

May 23, 17:53 UTC
Identified - The ongoing issues/delays with Github webhooks, https://twitter.com/githubstatus/status/734789351754846209, is resulting in us getting a large surge in builds. We're scaling up accordingly but there will some build delays as we bring more capacity online.

entry.title: Delays in all private travis-ci.com builds running
entry.content:
May 16, 16:08 UTC
Resolved - We've now processed all the build jobs that were in the backlog because of this issue and things are operating as expected. Thank you for your understanding.

May 16, 15:00 UTC
Identified - We've identified a configuration change in our scheduling service which was resulting in new jobs not being queued, We've fixed the configuration and are now beginning to queue jobs as expected. There will be some delay as we catch up on the backlog of jobs. We'll post updates as we work through the backlog.

May 16, 14:50 UTC
Investigating - We're seeing delays in the backend service which is responsible for scheduling new jobs and are investigating why.

entry.title: Delayed build processing
entry.content:
May 13, 08:37 UTC
Resolved - This issue has been resolved, and we've worked through the backlog.

May 13, 07:50 UTC
Identified - We’ve identified two issues affecting database performance. We’ve already fixed on of them, and builds are processing normally, working through the backlog, so there might still be increased wait times while we work through the backlog of builds. We’re working on resolving the second issue, which has had a non-critical impact on database load.

May 13, 07:15 UTC
Investigating - We're seeing investigating performance in build request processing due to high database load on both platforms.

entry.title: Delayed Builds on the Docker Build Infrastructure
entry.content:
May 12, 15:53 UTC
Resolved - The queue has drained and we are processing jobs normally. Thank you for your patience.

May 12, 15:05 UTC
Monitoring - We are normally processing jobs, but have a slight backlog on the Docker build infrastructure. We are monitoring the situation, and it should resolve soon.

entry.title: Outbound Connectivity for OS X Build Infrastructure
entry.content:
May 11, 22:25 UTC
Resolved - We have resolved a misconfigured firewall on the OS X build infrastructure. If you are seeing network-based build failures, please restart your builds. Sorry for the inconvenience, and happy building.

entry.title: Internet connectivity issues in our OS X environment
entry.content:
May 10, 23:17 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

May 10, 21:01 UTC
Monitoring - We've confirmed that OS X builds continue to run as expected and the inbound access issues are not affecting builds.

May 10, 20:43 UTC
Update - Upon further investigation, connectivity may only be affecting certain *in-bound* traffic and outbound connectivity for our OSX builds should not be impacted. We'll provide another update shortly

May 10, 20:35 UTC
Investigating - We are investigating internet connectivity issues in our OS X environment

entry.title: Investigating issues with public and private OSX builds
entry.content:
May 6, 18:49 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

May 6, 18:49 UTC
Update - At this time we've caught up on the public OSX build backlog and things are operating as expected.

May 6, 18:12 UTC
Monitoring - We've caught up on our backlog for private OSX builds. We expect to to catch up on the public OSX build backlog within two hours or so and will provide an update when we do.

May 6, 16:17 UTC
Update - We're still working through the backlog for both public and private builds and will post updates as soon as this starts to clear up.

May 6, 14:37 UTC
Update - We've resumed all builds, we currently have large backlogs for both public and private builds. We'll provide updates as we get a better idea of how long the backlog will last.

May 6, 14:30 UTC
Update - We've been able to resolve the underlying issues and are working to restore build services

May 6, 14:17 UTC
Update - We are continuing to troubleshoot issues in the underlying infrastructure.

May 6, 13:47 UTC
Identified - We are working with our infrastructure provider to restart some underlying services and will provide another update shortly

May 6, 13:03 UTC
Update - All OSX builds are paused as we look into this issue

May 6, 12:58 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

entry.title: Build delays for public and private sudo enabled builds
entry.content:
May 5, 21:01 UTC
Resolved - At 18:00 UTC we began seeing a spike in errors from the API used to create VMs for our sudo enabled builds. This resulted in unusually long delays in job start times and resulted in build cancellation delays as well. The API errors stopped at 18:15 UTC and build delays continued until approximately 18:35 UTC. If you have any further questions regarding this issue, please email support@travis-ci.com

entry.title: OS X infrastructure issue
entry.content:
Apr 29, 21:19 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Apr 29, 20:29 UTC
Monitoring - We've resumed OS X jobs and we're monitoring the situation.

Apr 29, 20:03 UTC
Identified - We've identified an issue with our OS X infrastructure causing degraded performance and we're temporarily holding any new builds from starting in the OS X queue until the issue is resolved.

entry.title: Inbound email support delays due to provider issues
entry.content:
Apr 22, 05:12 UTC
Resolved - Service was restored and our support ticketing is working as expected.

Apr 21, 22:38 UTC
Monitoring - There may be delays in support responses due to our ticketing system provider currently experiencing some inbound email service issues, http://status.helpscout.net/incidents/0qjmnv2vy7m1.

We'll provide an update when this has been resolved.

entry.title: Some build restarts for public sudo enabled builds
entry.content:
Apr 21, 20:14 UTC
Resolved - We've finished deploying this configuration change and are monitoring things closely.

Apr 21, 19:10 UTC
Monitoring - We're rolling out a change to the infrastructure for public sudo enabled builds, that will result in some build restarts, but will help fix the issues where builds are stopped while still showing a *passed* status.

entry.title: Mac build processing delay
entry.content:
Apr 13, 23:52 UTC
Resolved - We have worked through the .org back log. Everything is operating normally.

Apr 13, 23:20 UTC
Monitoring - Capacity is back normal. We have worked through .com back log. We continue to monitor .org back log.

Apr 13, 23:19 UTC
Identified - The system issue has been identified. We are restarting VMs to restore capacity.

Apr 13, 23:12 UTC
Update - We continue to investigate system level issues. All Mac builds are temporarily paused.

Apr 13, 22:55 UTC
Update - .org builds are also affected.

Apr 13, 22:48 UTC
Investigating - We are investigating build processing issue with private Mac builds

entry.title: Github.com outage
entry.content:
Apr 5, 23:35 UTC
Resolved - At this time we've caught up on all backlog and are processing builds as expected.

Apr 5, 22:40 UTC
Update - We're processing backlogs on builds as Github is recovering and will update when all the backlogs have been cleared. Things are looking stable overall.

Apr 5, 21:40 UTC
Update - Github is beginning to send us webhook events again and we're monitoring things closely as the build volume goes back up.

Apr 5, 21:19 UTC
Update - Github is reporting improved performance. We are continuing to monitor things

Apr 5, 20:57 UTC
Monitoring - Github is currently experiencing a site outage, https://twitter.com/githubstatus/status/717455416934981632. We are monitoring things closely.

entry.title: GitHub Service Outage
entry.content:
Apr 5, 11:57 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Apr 5, 09:51 UTC
Update - Builds are now processing normally. We’ll continue monitoring systems closely.

Apr 5, 09:19 UTC
Monitoring - We are processing builds at this time. We have some back logs on container builds on both public and private repositories.

Apr 5, 08:59 UTC
Identified - Build processing has stalled on all build infrastructures due to GitHub service outage.

entry.title: Brief routing issue for our OSX infrastructure's Internet transit
entry.content:
Mar 30, 10:09 UTC
Resolved - We experienced a brief routing issue with our OSX's infrastructure Internet transit from 09:45 to 10:05 UTC. This resulted in some build restarts and some delayed builds. At this time things are operating as expected. If you see any issues with OS X builds, please email support@travis-ci.com

entry.title: Build delays for public (travis-ci.org) Mac OS X builds
entry.content:
Mar 23, 13:48 UTC
Resolved - The backlog has been cleared and builds are processing normally again. We'll continue to monitor systems closely over the next few hours. Thanks for your patience!

Mar 23, 12:38 UTC
Monitoring - We've been able to return the workers to full capacity and are working on processing the accumulated backlog of .org OSX builds

Mar 23, 12:02 UTC
Update - We’re still working to narrow down a root cause of the workers issues. We'll update you as soon as we figure out what's going on.

Mar 23, 10:07 UTC
Identified - We're having problems with Mac OS X workers, which decreased builds capacity. This in turn may lead to delays in starting builds. We're investigating a way to fix it.
